snippet.title: Backpackers hailed heroes after baby whale rescue
snippet.content: TWO French backpackers have saved the life of a baby whale on the Sunshine Coast. The ABC reported yesterday that a seven-metre whale calf had been rescued, refloated, and reunited with its mum by two backpackers at Noosa. It is not confirmed how the whale calf became stuck, but the incident comes only days The calf was lucky to survive, The two whales beached themselves in a shallow, narrow area of the Great Sandy Strait.
